alert.note: Alert for Osage; Rogers; Tulsa; Washington (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 05 at 7:37PM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT WEST CENTRAL ROGERS... SOUTHEASTERN OSAGE...SOUTHERN WASHINGTON AND NORTHEASTERN TULSA COUNTIES THROUGH 800 PM CDT... At 737 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated a strong thunderstorm near Sperry, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations in or near the path include... Tulsa... Sand Springs... Owasso... Skiatook... Catoosa... Collinsville... Verdigris... Sperry... Vera... Turley... Tulsa International Airport... Gray... This includes Interstate 44 near mile marker 218, between mile markers 231 and 232, and between mile markers 239 and 244. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until midnight CDT for northeastern Oklahoma.
